item.name: 1960: The Making of the President
item.comment: A light knock off of Twilight Struggle. Not as deep as its older brother, but easier to play and teach. I feel the time frame helps attract more gamers also. Fun card driven game that has you vying the presidency. Fun game, but sometimes I feel like you could pick your cards at random and still have a good shot at winning.
item.conditiontext: Box has ding in the middle of the side of the box. It's noticeable but not bad. The rest of the game is in like new condition. Got it that way as ding and dent.

item.name: 7 Wonders
item.comment:
Solid game. There was a lot to learn this first game out. I'll need to play a few more games to give this a final rating.
10.12.14 Lowered my rating to 6.5 as this game just does not do it for me our my game group.

item.name: Advanced Squad Leader: Starter Kit #1
item.comment:
The boards and cutouts are not what they used to be, but still as fun as I remembered.
A great way to get back into or learn ASL. I enjoyed my plays and wish I had a partner to enjoy even more.

item.name: The Adventurers: The Pyramid of Horus
The Adventurers: The Temple of Chac
item.comment:
This game is a solid 8 for me. Hits the sweet spot between fun play and decision making. Everybody has the same chance. It has been a great success in our game group.
After several more play this game had jumped to a 9.5. It just has the right feel for a group game. Simple, yet many ways to try and win. While the board is the same, the adventure is different every time. Always a nice fast romp into board gaming. Fun each time... what else could you want.
2.12.12 I lowered my score back down to I think it's final resting place of 8.5. Still a wonderful games for our group.

item.name: Age of War
item.comment: 4.12.15 After a dozen or so plays we have enjoyed this game immensely in our group. We enjoy this for the light dice game that it is, but it really ups the "game decisions" that can be made from similar dice game like Yahtzee or Zombie Dice. This is a hit and we continue to all want to play. Also, a good "step up" to players new to the hobby.

item.name: Alien Frontiers
item.comment: Have had an opportunity to play 2 four player games now. I generally like space based themes, rolling dice and placing workers, conflict, and variable power all of which this game has. The game was well thought out and works together very nice in all aspects. so why did I not like it more? not sure. First the scoring was a bit funky and everybody was at the same score with our last colonies about to end the game. I don't see this changing with subsequent games and one person can pretty much Kingmake the end. Also, we experienced a lot of downtime between turns which became almost tedious near the end as each person tried to MAX out their move to make all scores even. Still, there is fun here, but for my dollar... Lords of Waterdeep is a much better game.

item.name: Android: Netrunner
item.comment: 1.16.13 Love the way this game plays. I'll need more plays for a full analysis. Rating an 8 for openers.

item.name: Arena Maximus
item.comment: Light fun racing romp. Can be fun with the right crowd. I enjoy this one with the family and light hearted friends.

item.name: Arkham Horror
item.comment: I really like this game. I have played multiple times each solo and two players, but each was a blast. The theme is great for me as I am not a huge fan of the genre. Tense and fun, some call this a dice fest, but I disagree. Plenty of options each turn keep this fun. I have recently updated my score to 9 after two solo games and multi-player games. Any game that works well as a solo game and can be played with other players is a big plus for me. The only downside is the playing time which can run 4 hours, but if you can leave it out and come back to it there is no problem. It now has many expansion to enjoy your fun even more.
item.conditiontext: Played copy. The box has a dent on the bottom of the box. All other components are used but in good condition. Played 4 or 5 times but still a great game.

item.name: Axis & Allies
item.comment: A classic game for me. As a nice balanced war game, this one has it all IMHO. Direct conflict, purchasing, alliance, land, sea, and air combat make this one of my favorites still. It may not be super deep, but I always enjoy this one. Time can be a factor if you go for total domination, but one side usually concedes.

item.name: Axis & Allies Miniatures
item.comment: I have a decent size army and liked the game when it came out. But the collectable part is just not good. The random part makes it too hard to get what you need. I just got the contested skies box. I got three anti aircraft weapons and no aircraft. WTF. I think this has run its course for me.

item.name: Axis & Allies Naval Miniatures: War at Sea
item.comment:
Light, but deep Naval Game. Very enjoyable to play and the minis are nice. Too bad its collectible as it will take a bit of $ to get a nice set of fleets to play. Rate is after one play. I will be getting more minis and adjust my ratings after a few more plays.
Lowered my rating a bit after a few plays. The game is a bit tight with space and the good mini's cost. While enjoy the game, the two player only limits its scope of playability.

item.name: Axis & Allies: Guadalcanal
item.comment:
Well done A&A war game. An interesting war game that uses phased movement to try and keep both sides guessing. The battle box also helps with a random dispersion of hits to enemy units. Now, the defender does not always get to pick what gets hit. Good mix of war strategy, keeping your supplies moving forward, and purchasing.
I really like my 1st face to face game as it came down the the wire... after all the huge sea battles, it was a marine over run of a Japenses air field that won the day.

item.name: Axis & Allies: 1942
item.comment: The lack of money and a larger board are a drawback for this one. Still, all the enhancements to the board and the addition of artillery, destroyers and cruisers make for a full experience.

item.name: Axis & Allies: D-Day
item.comment: Played this game as I have most in the A&A series. While it has the A&A name the game is very different. It uses 16 scripted orders cards to complete a turn. While I do like this aspect, it is just not enough. While the game is fun, it really lacks the long range economic/building phases of the original A&A. Since all units are pre-determined (as in what was there on D-Day), you just never get to vary your strategy too much. The game is FUN the first few plays and is great to look at, but after a few games I just wanted more. If you want a fast invasion of France (and I do some times) this game is worth playing. If you want a good tense war game then look elsewhere.

item.name: Axis & Allies: Europe
item.comment: Brand new in shrink wrap.

item.name: B-17: Queen of the Skies
item.comment: A great, easy to learn, a solo game that is both fun and realistic! The game is more of a script as you don't have to make to many agonizing decisions. The tension comes from the loss of crew members and planes. Still, I enjoy this when I play.

item.name: Backgammon
item.comment: The old classic. Can be fun at the right time, but there are just so many better games I would rather play. Just my opinion.

item.name: BANG!
item.comment:
Very fun card game. Even more fun with the right group. I like that after a play, it seems we always want to play one more. Each game is different with the changing characters. You may not want to be the sheriff if you don't want to be shot at a lot from the get go.
I've had some great games and a few duds. Must be in the mood for this one, as well as all playing.
BANG!
10.12.14 this game has been fired for the dice game version. Not sure this will every come out again. but I did enjoy my plays.

item.name: BANG! A Fistful of Cards
item.comment: Interesting addition to the bang game. Add a set of variables that apply to all players in the game. Changes the scheme of the game, but a nice addition once in a while.

item.name: BANG! The Dice Game
item.comment:
4.14.14 This is a great addition to the base Bang! game. In ways, it's a bit better than the card game. The only downside is if you don't like the randomness of dice rolls. Played with four and it seems the Sheriff had a hard time living and wins rarely. Played with 6 players and it added a lot to the game, but the sheriff won most of the games. Still, I want to play this game each time and I do enjoy. Initial rating of 7. I'll give it some time and plays and see if that goes up or down. 5.27.14 Played this at my Ron-CON and the game really shined. Had some great games and I have bumped up my score to 7.5
10.12.14 I have raised my rating a full point to 8.5 this game has seen consistent table play and I think it will continue in the future.

item.name: Battle Beyond Space
item.comment: 2/18/13 Neat little beer and pretzels space combat game. while it was light and fun not something I'd like to play all the time.

item.name: Battle Cry
item.comment: Upped my rating after a few plays under my belt. As stated by others here. I think the CDW system used here works well for the Civil War era. It makes movement much more critical as units can get wiped out in a hurry. Includes leaders which help in combat and good mix of cards. A very well done 2 player game.. and it looks nice.

item.name: Battle Cry: 150th Civil War Anniversary Edition
Battleball
item.comment: For a cheap little romp, this is not a bad game. Easy to setup and play I like it for what it is. Fast, easy, and cheap. At least some things come as they pretent to be!

item.name: Battleground
item.comment:
Good idea. Check low cost. Check East to play check
Why I did not like this I don't know. It just did not grab me.

item.name: Battleground: Crossbows & Catapults War Chest Starter Set
item.comment: What can I say, you fling plastic chips at your opponents castles and men. A Masterpiece this is not, fun with the kids.... bingo.

item.name: BattleLore
item.comment: Enhanced Memoir 44 game. I think it does most of the same concepts but a bit better. The lore is a big component of the game, but can sometimes sway the game too much. I still enjoy the game, but have lowered my score as I don't look forward to as many plays as I once had. It is still a solid Borg game which I enjoy when we play.

item.name: Battleship Galaxies: The Saturn Offensive Game Set
item.comment: Great lightweight space combat game. While you do loose some of the depth of a true space combat game, the simplicity more than make up for it. I like that you can use cards to augment your ships to give them a different feel. I also like that combat shots can miss with the die roll. I'm sure some won't like that, but I enjoy randomness my game.

item.name: Battlestations
item.comment:
Two plays at cons. While I enjoy this game a lot, it's nice to be a player and not so much the GM. All my plays have been with the designer Jeff Saidek, which is why this is probably rated so high for me. Still, even in a group with the rules down, I would enjoy this.
2/17/13 Another play at the con. Another fun time.

item.name: BioShock Infinite: The Siege of Columbia
Blind Justice
item.comment: I wish I were blind, so I could have passed on being talked into playing this. An old school game.

item.name: Blockade Runner
item.comment: 8.30.14 Plyaed with designer at Stratigicon. I really enjoyed this game and how it flowed. It really catches the feel of being a blockade runner during the civil war. I rate this a 7.5 but I give it a boot as I really enjoyed the theme and playing with the designer was a big plus. If your inclined to learn this area, then give it a try.

item.name: Blokus
item.comment: Nice brain teaser game. A puzzle game that allows for some (I don't think too much) blocking strategy. This is a good game, but I would not have paid full price for this. Great for a light beginning or ending game of the night or for non games who may like puzzle games.

item.name: Blood Bowl: Team Manager – The Card Game
item.comment: 8/7.13 If you have a few guys who want to battle it out in a sports game two hours that can support four players this is the game. Actually any gamers who like direct conflict should like this. Initial rating of 7 has been bumped up to 8 after play with 3 or more players. Just enough confrontation, card play, and dice rolling to be right up my alley.

item.name: Bohnanza
item.comment:
What a great little card game. This has been increasingly one of our favorite card games to play on game night. The game has just the right amount of strategic play, interaction, and slight screwage factor to keep you interested on each card turned over. All players are involved on each turn so it's a big plus. You hand management, trading, and donating cards all makes this one fine game when all players are involved.
I had this for years before playing, after my 1st rating of an 8, I have bumped this up to a 9 for me.

item.name: Boss Monster: The Dungeon Building Card Game
Break the Safe
item.comment: Fun family game that is co-op. I actually like the game. It so random yet fun. One I can play with the little ones a teenager. I love Co-op games so this just makes it fun for me.

item.name: A Bridge Too Far: Operation Market Garden
item.comment: This hits so many sweet spots for me in war gaming. I will write more later, but for now. I'd love for this to be the premier two player game.

item.name: Britannia
item.comment: Interesting War game. Great for the time period represented. Not the easiest to learn, but not a brain burner also. Felt a little lost on strategy on the first game, but still fun. Also, scoring can be an exercise in math. Still if you are interested in the time period and like war games, it's worth giving it a try. If your on the fence or don't have war game buddies to play with, then I would pass.

item.name: Broadsides and Boarding Parties
item.comment: Another Classic game for me. The card maneuvering aspect of this game is the biggest draw for me. Combat is reduced to simple die rolling to see where you hit or miss. This part can be a bit anti climatic, but pulverizing an enemy ship when you use superior movement is quite satisfying.

item.name: Bruges
item.comment: 7.5.14. there is a lot going on here and you need to balance between building your engine and people and going for points. Only one game in so far, but I like what it does.

item.name: The Burning Blue
item.comment: Wow, Like an epic movie. You must make the time, but well worth it!

item.name: Ca$h 'n Gun$
item.comment:
Some fun to be here with the right crowd. Another one of those game that depends on how much the group wants to play. I have enjoyed my plays, but it is very light.
Started playing this again with my game group. Having a fully participating group makes this game much more fun. While not a brain burner, there is some fun to be had here.
After even more plays I have upped my score on this to a 7. I have fun when I play. It's fast, fun and easy to play and continues to entertain after a dozen plays.

item.name: Can't Stop
item.comment: An average push your luck game. Not the best but some fun is to be had here. I love dice so this was a must game for me.

item.name: Cards Against Humanity
item.comment: 8/5/13 There is fun to be had with the right crowd, that's to be sure. It's a very basic game of picking the right card for the question. While some very funny outcomes will ensue, it just does not have the game play I like to keep me interested very long.

item.name: Cards Against Humanity: The Bigger, Blacker Box
Cargo Noir
item.comment: 11.10.13 After playing the game wrong at first, we started over. While a fun light weigh auction game, there is just something missing. I enjoyed the game and did have fun, but I personally want something a little more meaty. Might be a good gateway game to introduce players to auction and set collection games.

item.name: Castle Panic
item.comment:
Just a bit on the light side, but still good clean fun. The game is made to go down to the wire each time. This is great for a kids or family game or just some light gaming. Not a lot of depth but a thumbs up for fun.
8.3.14 Dropped my rating from 7.4 to 6.5. The drop is basically in that the game is just too simple. While there are some choices most of them are easily to see and the threats are imminent, so the only real issues is when you lack cards. Still a fun co-op or family game and this will come out time to time.

item.name: Catan
item.comment: Great game for more talkative and trading groups. It does this very well. Fun to play with lots of interaction to make this fun. Runs a little long for me, but still always a blast to play.

item.name: Catan
item.comment:
While not the great Grail it once was, I still rate this a 9. With knowledgeable players this can be completed in under an hour. It can drag a bit with new or slow players. Still, I enjoy the building and trading aspect this game has to offer. Keeps things social with trading, yet competition for space keeps things tense.
Still a 9, even with it's limitations.

item.name: Catan: 5-6 Player Extension
item.comment: While it does let you add more players it just seemed to add time to our game.

item.name: Checkers
item.comment: there are just so many better games to play in the same time. Why... oh why would I play this.

item.name: Citadels
item.comment:
This game is at the top of my list to play for good reason. There are so many strategies that it boggles the mind. Should you try and out build your opponents, steal their cards, take their money, or just assassinate them. You never know who has which role and the roles change each turn.
People with great intuition for what the other person will do seem to always win or at least have a great shot at winning. Most games are close and I keep the game moving so it does not drag on. I have yet to play this game and not enjoy it.

item.name: Citadels: The Dark City
item.comment: A nice expansion for one of my games rated a 10. While not needed to play, this does add a lot of new building to try out.

item.name: Cleopatra and the Society of Architects
item.comment: Very nice building game with some interesting mechanics. Not a lot of direct confrontation but a race to build. Corruption is a nice little bonus to keep you from becoming too greedy. Easy to play and teach.

item.name: Clue Mysteries
item.comment: Nice and easy family game. Works well for kids and adults alike and give each person a fair chance to win. Very simple mechanics that use some interesting way to find out who is telling, who and where.

item.name: Combat Commander: Europe
item.comment:
2/19/12 finally got a chance to play this is this one fantastic game. There is just the right amount tension between having the right order, chaotic events and trying to obtain your objective.
If you want to try a well designed squad level game, do wait as long as I did to give this a try.

item.name: Commands & Colors: Ancients
item.comment:
This is a great game. My rating may go up after a few plays. My real gripe about this game is GMT's production of it. Im sorry. Most items are cheap including the board, the terrain, and OMG the DICE. For what they ask in price, this game does not deliver on components. Only the great gameplay from Richard Borg saves this game.
I think the leaders really make this more innovative than the other C&C games. very enjoyable and tons of expansions.
10.12.14 I have raised my rating to 9. This is a great game and deserves the rating despite my component gripe.
item.haspartslist: Extra small wood blocks of both grey and brown

item.name: Concept
item.comment: 8.30.14 Played at Stratigicon. The game has some fun elements and is basically charades with a board. The real issue is trying to convey the words with ONLY the symbols on the board. Sure this can be a big part of the fun, but it is also the part that can be frustrating. Being in sync with someone seems to help.

item.name: Cowboys: The Way of the Gun
item.comment: Well, it is a Cowboy gunfighting game and I love the theme. Like most have said there are some issues with the game. Mostly it is just too simple for what it COULD be. Basically you either move OR shoot, which means someones has to just be aggressive. With that said, we did implement some house rules to spice up the game. One is we determine initiative every turn and two, allow the addition of more cards during the match. Even though it's basic, it still has some fun to be had. Perfect for play with kids or a no brainier evenings.

item.name: Cutthroat Caverns
item.comment: Nice take that card game. Can very fun with the right group. Like most card or text trumps rules, there are some timing issues that come up. Still, it can be very fun with the right group.

item.name: Cyclades
item.comment:
I love conflict games, so this one with the greek theme caught my eye right off. also, the game bits are darn cool and can really make the game look beautiful.
I have only one game under my belt, but the trifecta of bidding, income, and combat make a for a fast and intense game. the creature can cause huge swings in the game so be warned.
Played a full 5 players and I was disappointed with the amount of combat and interaction in the game. All the components and mechanics work well, but you just never needed to invade anybody to win. Big minus in my book.

item.name: Dead of Winter: A Crossroads Game
Descent: Journeys in the Dark
item.comment: Great game, Its a fun dungeon delving adventure. The game has lots of things to do on both sides so it can be fun. Time is the biggest factor for me. It takes a good few hours to play the smallest of adventures and 4+ for the big ones. Lots of stuff to sift through if you are the overlord also. Still a very fun game.

item.name: Diamant
item.comment: A very fun lightweight push you luck game. Works well with any age and those who like the gambling feeling. I like that it can be played in about 15 minutes and setup and take down is pretty fast. Good family game.

item.name: Dixit
item.comment:
Nice simple game. I think it must be played with at least 5 people.
The real interesting part is coming up with the sentence that will not be to easy or too hard. The rest is pretty standard. Fun to be had, but maybe a little light for my taste.
After another few plays with 5 and 6 players I will stand by my statement that it's still a little too light for me. Works great for families and new games though.

item.name: A Dog's Life
item.comment: A fun little game with quite a few choices. The game can drag on a little long, especailly for little ones who may want to play with the little dogs. Worth a try now and then, but did not fit the family game I was hoping for.

item.name: Dominion
item.comment:
Great deck building game. Easy to learn and easy to teach make this a great intro game in my opinion. Gets better when you play with others who really like this genre of games. My rating has gone up from and 8 to 9 and I play this a bit more.
1/29/12 After more plays I have dropped my play back down to a 8 on this. Still a great game, but it lacks the player interaction that I love so much in games.

item.name: Don't You Forget It
item.comment: A nice light dice game. Actually has more depth than meets the eye. Basically a dice rolling push your luck game. Great for camping or light gaming.

item.name: Doom: The Boardgame
item.comment: I like the epic type board games and DOOM is just that. I can be brutal on the Marines to get through a mission. Sometimes it seems they just don't have a chance, but if you like a tough challenge this game is for you. Great components for this one. Playing time can run a bit long also.

item.name: Down in Flames: Aces High
item.comment: Only one play with single plane. While I liked the game, I was very routed due to my bad hand and great hand of my opponent. Still, I'd would like to try a bigger engagement or a scenario. Game rating may go up then.

item.name: Dream Factory
item.comment: Interesting game. Light on rules and fun to play. I enjoy this, but I have yet to decide if there is actual skill in winning. I think luck and some good bluffing is all you need. Still, it's fun each time we play so I give it a thumbs up. Works well for family games.

item.name: Duel in the Dark
item.comment: I had high anticipation to get this one. A game with both solo rules and two player action. I was sold. Single night solo games can be a bit boring, but I find multi-night games can be tense. Two player games can be fun, but not the thrill, on the edge of your seat game I wanted. It looks great and plays pretty well. Hit on most points for me, but just not enough to play often.

item.name: Dungeon Roll
item.comment: 10.30.13 I found the game lacking any real merits. I like dice, solo games, and dungeon theme, so I should love it. There is just no much of a game here and to me this is the poster child of problems with Kickstarter. The backers put money in so rate it high, when in reality, this game would probably never seen much in the way of sales. A lifeless filler in which I can find so many other better games in the same time frame.
item.conditiontext: Please take this off my hands.

item.name: Dungeon Twister
item.comment: Brand new in shrink wrap.

item.name: Dungeoneer: Dragons of the Forsaken Desert
Dungeoneer: Haunted Woods of Malthorin
item.comment: I love these little game. A little hard to get an opponent.

item.name: Dungeoneer: Tomb of the Lich Lord
item.comment:
Probably the best of the series. The dungeon setting works best for me. I did not have too much trouble with the rules and just applied common sense.
Dropped from an 8 to 7. While this is not a knock on the game, I think it just shows my lower drive for this kind of game. The cards only approach, while nice and compact leave a bit to be desired.

item.name: Dungeons & Dragons Dice Masters: Battle for Faerûn
Dungeons & Dragons: Castle Ravenloft Board Game
item.comment:
So after many plays, I still rate this game of 9.5. While it's very simple and does have some flaws, I do find it fun.... and that's why I play games.
Having being the DM or GM in any role playing or dungeon crawl game, it's nice to actually play the game with my fellow cohorts. The modular game system will be expanded on in the future and I see me playing this game for some time.
Dropped my ratings only slight after several plays with several groups. The came can get monotonous, but the different types of adventures keep it fresh.
5.17.15 after a long hiatus we pulled this out and played two player. Had a great time and it will stay at an 8 for me.

item.name: Dungeons & Dragons: The Legend of Drizzt Board Game
Dungeons & Dragons: The Legend of Drizzt Board Game
Elder Sign
item.comment:
This is my current solo game to play.
Ever play that one game of Arkham Horror that took just a bit too long. AH light this is not. This is a full game based on the HP Lovercrat Mythos setting. This game has all the elements of the AH in a perfect packaged sized game. There are definite decisions to be made in this game. Some may call it a dice fest, but I disagree. It's a probability management game. Also, I like dice so this is not an issue for me. It probably would be a 10 for me, except there are some niggle rules that need to learned and kept in mind.
Still, for the price, components, and fun playing time.. This game is a winner.

item.name: Escape: The Curse of the Temple
Fast 111's
item.comment: My young kids love to play this game. Easy counting game with a slight decision factor. We play at least 3 games each time it comes out.

item.name: A Few Acres of Snow
item.comment: 2.19.12 An interesting game between the French and British in America. This game took me a bit to get my head around as it is not a straight war game. On it's face it looks like one, but in my game, there was only ever one big siege. The goal is to build you hand and get the cards you need to do the things you want. Also, you have money management and settlers you need to take important area in to the mix. While I did enjoy the game, im not sure this is must own for me. While there is lots to do, it really did seem more of deck building game more than anything.

item.name: Field Commander: Rommel
item.comment:
Fantastic solo war game. Very easy to pick up and learn to play. Well done DVG. Although there is re playability for these, I would like to see more scenarios.
10.12.14 I have given this 9 as it is my favorite solo war game. As a game its a 7+.

item.name: Firefly: The Game
item.comment: 11.8.13 I had never seen the show, so my view is just of the two game plays. First, this game is a pickup and deliver game at it's core. You must like that or the game will seem repetitive. I enjoy the way the incorporate the theme into the game and how crew and items help shape your firefly. All the components are very well done but man does this game take up some serious table space. The game seems to integrate all the aspects very well but never seems hard or convoluted. There is some randomness and until you get a crew going, you may just get some bad luck. All in all a fun game that runs a little on the long side if you don't watch it. Your mileage may vary depending on how much you like: the show, randomness, low player interaction, and immersion.

item.name: Flash Point: Fire Rescue
item.comment: A nice co-op game. While I do like the theme, co-op and random fire aspects this game still does not come close to de-troning Pandemic for me. I have only played the basic game so, this has the chance if the advanced plays offer more game.

item.name: For Sale
item.comment:
Great fun game. Plays fast, has very cool game play. The bidding and selling can be tricky depending on what is up. We enjoy this game and get four games in an hour. Goes well with both young and old. Give it a try, you might be surprised.
After many plays, this still is a winner for me. I enjoy it and usually play two games back to back.

item.name: Forbidden Desert
item.comment: 2.3.14 Another nice light family/filler game. I think this one works pretty good to get someone into gaming who can handle more than the gateway games. It's better than forbidden island IMO and had just enough tension. Looks good setup and the pieces are top notch.

item.name: Forbidden Island
item.comment:
What a light and lovely game. The price point is good, but im not sure if there is enough of a game here to keep it coming back to the table.
Still, I want more plays to decide if it is keeper.

item.name: Fortress America
item.comment: America attacked from all sides while it rains down lasers... im all in. Even though the game relies on dice for combat and random cards, the game still seems very tense and even. I enjoy this game when it hits the table. I wish I had more time to play this one.

item.name: Fury of Dracula (second edition)
item.comment: The more I play it the more I like its little nuances. It can be VERY tough for Dracula, but the game gets just a bit better each time I play. The mechanic is great in my opinion. Co-Op and vs at the same time.

item.name: Gears of War: The Board Game
item.comment: 10.9.14 got back into playing this after a year 1/2 time away. I upped my score from a 7 to an 8. After you get the rules down it's a pretty straight forward game. Great feel for a shoot em up type Ameritrash board game. Can be a bit long with all four players on the harder scenarios. I give it a solid 8 for the gameplay, rules set, and to factor... all of which I like.

item.name: GiftTRAP
item.comment: A Clever game where you try to match giving and getting based upon the items and players. While it can be fun, there is just something missing about this game. I think that is pretty much the same thing each round and no real DEEP decisions. Fun with the right group or in a family, but still, I can only break it out once in a while.

item.name: Going, Going, GONE!
item.comment:
2.15.14 While a bit fun, there is not much of a game here. Gave this game an initail rating of 5.
5.17.14 After our 2nd player, it was unanimous to never play this again and trade away. Bad components, cheap game play, and not much else. I can't believe I paid for this game and I am rating a 2.

item.name: Guesstures
item.comment: Can be fun with the right crowd. Seems like the time to act out was very short. Still fun if your in the mood.

item.name: Hammer of the Scots
item.comment: One of the premier block games for me. While fairly easy to play, it does take some getting used to. Interesting card play and wintering make this one that can replayed over and over.

item.name: HeroClix
item.comment: The pieces are neat. For some reason the game is just boring for me. I would much rather play Star Wars minis or Axis and Allies Minis.

item.name: HeroQuest
item.comment: Light fun dungeon crawl. Easy enough for all to play. I like that. Not to serious and deep to scare off would be beginners.

item.name: Heroscape Expansion Set: Crest of the Valkyrie (Flagbearer series)
item.comment: Meh, I have them, but rarely use them.

item.name: Heroscape Expansion Set: Dawn of Darkness
Heroscape Expansion Set: Fortress of the Archkyrie
item.comment: Some of the best terrain for the series can be found here.

item.name: Heroscape Expansion Set: Jandar's Oath
item.comment: Another great expansion for this game. The commons are alright in this expansion, but I really like the Heroes.

item.name: Heroscape Expansion Set: Malliddon's Prophecy
item.comment: The first expansion with units that can make a difference. Also, has expansion glyphs.

item.name: Heroscape Expansion Set: Orm's Return
item.comment: This expansion adds some of the best units to expand on this great game.

item.name: Heroscape Expansion Set: Raknar's Vision
item.comment: Another great addition. Some really strong heroes in this batch. Almost too strong, but the point cost help balance this out.

item.name: Heroscape Expansion Set: Road to the Forgotten Forest
item.comment: The best terrain expansion for this game. The trees look great. A must have for any map builder.

item.name: Heroscape Expansion Set: Thaelenk Tundra
item.comment: Like the Lava of the series. Looks great and adds some terrain building scenarios. Still nothing like the tree and road expansion.

item.name: Heroscape Expansion Set: Utgar's Rage
item.comment: A solid expansion set with some great heroes. Still, maybe one of the weaker expansion so far.

item.name: Heroscape Expansion Set: Volcarren Wasteland
item.comment: Not bad terrain to limit some access to areas, but not enough.

item.name: Heroscape Expansion Set: Zanafor's Discovery
item.comment: I own but have not used in battle yet.

item.name: Heroscape Marvel: The Conflict Begins
item.comment: Nice blend of Heroscape with Marvel comics heroes and villains. The game actually works really well within the confines of the Heroscape world. My only problem is the lack of terrain and characters in the base set. With that said, the units in the base game do mix to make a nice playable setting and a pretty balanced game. After a few more plays I have lowered my rating from 8 to 7. While I do still like this game there are some issue. As a stand alone game, it is fun, but it lacks enough terrain and glyphs to make a truly spirited map. Also, these guys are powerful. Don't mix them with lower heroscape units.

item.name: Heroscape Master Set: Rise of the Valkyrie
item.comment: I find this game very enjoyable. I love the creatures. I love the tiles that you can use to build your OWN map. Simple rules with lots of decisions. Some may say that combat system is a bit simple, but hitting your opponent only to see them blocked is what this game is all about. I have played with both youth and adults and we always have fun playing the game. It can get a bit expensive with all the expansions, but I buy them, because they get used! I will never turn down a game of Heroscape.

item.name: Heroscape Master Set: Swarm of the Marro
item.comment: A solid edition to the Heroscape line. If you love the marro (and someone always does) this takes them to a new level. Works as both an addition for terrain and new units and as a stand alone game. Not a MUST have, but darn close.

item.name: Heroscape Master Set: Swarm of the Marro
Heroscape: Nerak's Return
item.comment: An OK figure, Im just sad to see exclusive units that you can only get at cons or on Ebay.

item.name: Hey, That's My Fish!
item.comment: This game get a lot of rave reviews, but I only find it luke warm. The big draw is that I can play with my kids who really enjoy the game. I find it a tad to basic and more work to setup that worth playing some times.

item.name: Hive
item.comment:
One of the newer abstract games that I enjoy. The low price point, portability, and easy teach and play time of this game make it a hit off the bat.
Couple that with a innovative design and the evolving tactics that one learns while playing the game and you can see why this game is one that you should at least try if you have another player who enjoys this type of game.
I give it rating of an 8, down a bit from my initial score of 9. Still, this is a great, fast and fun game to pull out almost anywhere due to its portability.

item.name: Hornet Leader
item.comment: I enjoy the solitaire games when I have the chance. The game seems complex but is pretty easy. Tons of options so that each mission is not the same. The theme and time frame of the game are attractive to me.

item.name: A House Divided
item.comment: The game is ok condition, but I love the area movement. Battles can be very fun. Great small war game. Decisions can be tough to make and the game ebbs and flows.
item.conditiontext: Fair, box and map are good, chits have some wear.

item.name: I'm the Boss!
item.comment:
After about 4 plays of this game I am bumping this to an 8. This just hits the sweet spot for our group. Lot's of negotiation, take that, and alliance... all in about 60 minutes playing time. I have enjoyed each of my plays of this game and look forward to each new play.
After even more plays, this game creeps up to a 9 for me. As a negotiation game, this one hits the top for me and my group. We have become shrewd investors and can't wait to play this when it comes out. Even more plays, and this game shines. Never a dull moment.

item.name: In the Year of the Dragon
item.comment: 8.1.14 A fine game in it's own right. The only real issue I have with this game is that the only real tension comes from the challenges that come at the end of the rounds. They are all known so you can "see" what others are driving at and what you can do. Still, there is some tension in trying to get the action you want to avoid these, but there just seems like it needs more for me. I will still play this and do enjoy it, but for now, I don't it see getting into our gaming rotation.

item.name: K-9 Capers
item.comment: Nice card game for younger gamers. Basically a memory game with a twist. You don't match but try and get the number from 1 - 9 in a row. Best part is that it plays very short.

item.name: Ker Plunk
item.comment: My kids just love this game. It's nothing special, but it gets a lot of play.

item.name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot
item.comment: While I have played this, I can't say it would be my first choice. There is just too much text, randomness to get an effective play.

item.name: King of Tokyo
item.comment:
6.9.13 There is a lot to like in this game. Starting with its price. The game is easy to teach and look pretty good all setup; nothing stellar, but does it well. Lots to do each turn like scoring points, doing damage, healing, or getting energy. While your goal is to score 20 points or kill all the other monsters, the cards and dice make sure each game is fresh and unique. A big hit with my game group and I give it an 8.
4.1.14 Introducing this to players at my work. Again it went over well. A great lunch time game that gives you that direct conflict rush without too much conflict. The theme keeps it light so it works perfect for that.
6.5.14 Have been playing this regularly with the power up cards and it has really added some depth of play to this game. Still getting tons of plays.

item.name: Kingdoms
item.comment: A tile laying game that involves a lot of math and strategic tile laying. This game has more depth than at first glace, but can be a brain burner. Don't play with anybody who has AP.

item.name: Kingsburg
item.comment:
I like this game initially and gave this a 7.
5/5/12 After repeated plays this game has gone over very well with our game group. Close game with meaningful decisions. Many ways to victory make this one that can get played many times.
7/29/13 Played yet again after a hiatus and we all enjoyed the game. Still give this an 8.5 and am looking forward to playing with the expansion at some point.

item.name: Kung Fu Fighting
item.comment: The game can drag on a bit, but still fun to play and scales well from two to six players. I like the game and have been able to teach both adults and children and they both liked it. A neat over looked take that Card Game!

item.name: Labyrinth: The War on Terror, 2001 – ?
item.comment:
There is a lot going on here. First game took me at least two read through of the rules to get the basic flow down.
Rating is after one play, I expect this to go higher and I get the hang of it and play both solo and 2 players.

item.name: Last Night on Earth: The Zombie Game
item.comment: Finally a fun zombie game. It can't be played too much but it's fun for what it is. There is a lot of luck with the cards you get and dice roll, but this simple mechanic is so much fun in the right hands. If you think thing theme will fit your group and you don't mind randomness, then get this game.

item.name: Legendary Encounters: An Alien Deck Building Game
Lifeboat
item.comment:
All plays at a con with designer Jeff Saidek. A fun little game, but does not have what it takes to get my hard earned money.
09/4/11. Played a 7 player game again with the designer Jeff S. This was a much more in depth game with 7 players. We had a blast and I have raised my rating to a 7.
1/7/12. After some more steady 5 player games, I have upped my score on this to a solid 8. This is a very nice social game which has more depth that meets the first game or two. I expect to get more plays of this.

item.name: London's Burning
item.comment: Nice war game covering the bombing of England. Rare game that can be played solitaire or 2 player co-op and 2 player head to head. The mechanics are good the rules are quite easy to learn.

item.name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game
item.comment:
After my first play of this game, I was very impressed. I won the first game so my initial rating of 9 was solid, but I thought it would go down.
I have played a few more games, all solo, and this game is still a solid 9 for me in that area. I still have 2 player games and expansions, not to mention actually building my own deck.
So far, i am loving this game and I don't think my rating of 9 will go down. I keep wanting to play this over and over.... that's a good thing.
Notes: the game was a little daunting at first. The unique style of LCG took a bit to get the hang of it. Watching a video here on BGG helped me understand the game flow. After that it was just a matter of doing and looking up as I went along. Well worth the effort.
11.15.13 I have been revisting the game in solo mode. this is still the wonderful solid game. I will probably get some more expansion desks. Still a 9 for me.
5.12.15 and I have started playing again. Beat the first two scenarios solo, but got a friend to help in two players to beat all three. Won the first scenario with two players and will finish the other two.

item.name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Khazad-dûm
Lord of the Rings: The Confrontation
item.comment: Enjoy this two player game. I like the theme and how it was applied. I like that there are counter moves to each character and the cards. A good move, bluff, counter bluff game. Easy to setup and play which is a plus.

item.name: Lords of Vegas
item.comment:
What a great interaction game. Some people may complain about dice and randomness, I think it works perfect with the Vegas theme.
Right now I rate this an 8, but can't wait to get more plays under my belt. 3rd play in and this game just wants to make me play more and more 4 player games. A great 4 player game with the perfect theme.

item.name: Lords of Waterdeep
item.comment:
Love this medium weight worker placement game. For our group it has just enough choices and random buildings to keep this game both interesting and close till the end.
6/2/12 Ok. After a few more plays with my group this game fits my game group and their tastes perfect. After four games the buildings have strove to make each game a unique experience. I have not rated a game a 10 for a while and this one suits that number. Each game has been close and everybody was in the game. Play and enjoy.
After still more plays this game shines. We have found it easy to teach new players which is a big plus. Even now that we all know the game each one is unique and interesting down to the end.
1.12.14 Played with the skullport expansion and this may be getting up there as my favorite game.

item.name: Lords of Waterdeep: Scoundrels of Skullport
item.comment: 1.12.14 Turns of of my favorite games that I rate a 10 to an 11. The addition of new spaces and corruption is just a nice touch. New lords, intrigue and quests make it a pure winner for me.

item.name: Lost Cities
item.comment: Intersting game. I like the game and theme, but does not hit all the points for me. A great card game for two players who want a simple but semi-deep game.

item.name: Love Letter
item.comment:
7.1.13 Initial rating was a 7 for this game. We all enjoyed it and it took a bit to get the feel. After more plays I have bumped this up to an 8. A great short filler deduction game. Our games are always close with 4 players so it gives everybody a chance.
11.10.13 I've come to enjoy this as a quick 2 player filler. While some think it may be lacking in the area, I think there is enough game. Very portable and playable in a small space is a big plus.

item.name: Magic: The Gathering
item.comment: While I wanted to like this game, the rules are just broken. The game has too many areas where interpretation of the written text can lead to disagrements. Too many cards from to many series with a lack of overall rules cohesion just make this game broken.

item.name: Mag·Blast (Second Edition)
item.comment: Great little game that my son and I like to play. We have instituted some house rules that really help. The rules are: we roll a d6 on a blast and roll of a 6 is a miss. Also, we go two rounds before you can attack or use your special power.

item.name: The Manhattan Project
item.comment: 8/26/23 What a great worker placement game. I not a HUGE fan of this genre, but do enjoy this game. Lots to do as the game goes from building your workforce and buildings to getting your economy and engine going, to building bombs. I like that you can interfere directly with other people in other ways than just "taking their spot". There is a lot going on, but you catch on pretty fast.

item.name: Martian Dice
item.comment: 4.12.15 Thought it would play like zombie dice which we love. While zombie dice is all about pushing you luck by pulling dice, this one works in reverse. You start will all of your dice and whittle your way down. It does not have the same effect as the dice determine your odds more than pushing your luck. Still some light fun to be had.

item.name: Memoir '44
item.comment:
Great game. I like that it plays fast and can be customized. Can be tough when you don't have the right cards, but when you do play a good one.... it's magic. I always look forward to playing this one just one more time. Expansion for this game enhance the basic game a great deal.
With all the new expansion, I have raised the base game up to a 9, if only for being the father of the series.

item.name: Memoir '44
item.comment:
1.29.15 After 69 play I still look forward to this game. Is it a war simulation? NO? Is there too much luck some times? YES Is there lopsided scenarios? YES.
But I love playing this game. It's fast and simple. Farily easy to teach to new players and most can grasp it quickly. Throw in the toy factor and you have a game that can easily be taught to most people and enjoyed by both.

item.name: Memoir '44: Breakthrough
item.comment:
I give this a 9.5. This is everything I wanted Memoir 44 to be. Great board, nice mission book, and a lot of scenarios. You do need most of the expansions to make the best use of this, but if your buying this, then you probably have most already.
The depth of the board really opens up the battles. Air rules, big guns, para drops, anti-tank weapons are all present.
Well done DOW.

item.name: Memoir '44: Eastern Front
item.comment: Probably the one of the best, if not the best in the expansions for this game. I like the commissar chip idea, in which the Russians have to pick they card to play a turn before. Great fun for the base game.

item.name: Memoir '44: Mediterranean Theater
item.comment: I like the setting, theme, and new units. The scenarios are not the best in my opinion.

item.name: Memoir '44: Overlord
item.comment: Still my favorite way to play Memoir.

item.name: Memoir '44: Pacific Theater
item.comment: Owned but yet to play.

item.name: Memoir '44: Terrain Pack
item.comment: I love the terrain in this set and what it brings to the Memoir 44 game. Like all the other small box expansions, I wish there were more scenarios. Still, this box is for one who wants to make scenarios.

item.name: Memoir '44: Tigers in the Snow
item.comment:
Great double sided map. Have played the Bridge to Far scenario once and had a blast. Great theme and some extras that carry the game a bit of ways from vanilla Memoir.
An initial 8, I have raised this slightly. We got a quite a few plays off this and could still play more.

item.name: Memoir '44: Winter/Desert Board Map
item.comment: For cosmetic appeal only. Not needed to play the game.

item.name: Mexican Train
item.comment: We play this with the parents when we put away a few bottles of wine. fun and easy to play with it's main drawback being the long playing time. Not bad if you want to play away the night on a light fun game.

item.name: Mice and Mystics
item.comment:
6.8.14 Sold to Jarred.
While I did like this game very much, it just was not going to get much play. I actually run a DnD group, so light rpgs-board games just don't have a real place. Sold to Jarred in the hope it will bring him fun and plays.

item.name: Mickey Bingo
item.comment: Cute game for small kids.

item.name: Monopoly Deal Card Game
item.comment: Wow, what a fun filler that turned out to be. We have enjoyed this inexpensive, portable, card game. Many plays of this and I still enjoy it. Who would have thought such a light game could be so much fun.

item.name: Monopoly Junior
item.comment: Great fun game to help kids add and subtract. Helps to learn money. 11.24.13 Gave away.

item.name: Monsters Menace America
item.comment: Brand new and unopened.

item.name: Mouse Trap
item.comment: theres a mouse and a trap. Just don't nudge the table... please.

item.name: Mr. Jack
item.comment:
Great two player deduction game. I like the subtleties that each player must use to try and escape/uncover Mr. Jack. My wife and I have played this a few times and enjoy it each time.
9.5.14 this game has stood the test of time for us. We still always enjoy our plays after years.We don't play it often but when we do.... it's spouse on spouse goodness. I still love how well this game is made. The characters work perfectly and crated just enough tension to make both sides edgy.
10.12.14 Raised to a 9 rating. Few two player games create this kind of tension for both players.

item.name: Nexus Ops
item.comment:
I enjoy this game. It's a light direct conflict romp that satisfies my wargame urge without having to have a full fledged war game. It's all about build and attack. Because of this, games generally do not drag on. Components are fairly good as is the rules.
9/4/11. I have been able to play this in tournaments and it has really shinned. I have raised my rating to an 8. This is mainly due to being able to play competitively.

item.name: Nexus Ops
item.comment: Brand new new version.

item.name: No Thanks!
item.comment: Light fun game. Has more depth than at first glance and play. Fun and easy with the press your luck/egg on the other player atmosphere.

item.name: Ogre
item.comment: This is new and unpunched

item.name: On the Underground
item.comment: 7.8.13 Rating is after one test game. I have not fully played the game with more than one player to learn the rules. Need another shot to give a full rating. Still, I found the game interesting, but a little flat for me.

item.name: One Night Ultimate Werewolf
item.comment: 2.2.14 I give this game a 7 not for the "great" game that it is, but for the ease of use and learning, quick play, and how it quickly introduces fun. Very basic but enough intrigue to play a few games back to back.

item.name: Operation Rescue Kit
item.comment: Nice updated version of the old kids game. It has four different games and three skill levels to keep from being just a one dimension game. Decent game to play with both younger and pre-teen kids. Don't expect anything but an updated version of the original and you'll be happy.

item.name: Othello
item.comment: Fun game and easy to play. I like to play when in the mood, but I love more involved games.

item.name: Pachisi
item.comment: For such an easy game this just drags on too long for me. Will play when the kids ask, but thats it!

item.name: Pandemic
item.comment:
8.4.2009 I love co-op games. This one is a quick and fun co-op at it's best. Very accessible by all types of players. I like the way its a team against the system. Rating after a few plays. Will revise when played more.
Played about 12 times now and my rating has not lowered. Although I do find that I don't want to play time after time, I do still find that I enjoy it each time. Finally beat it on hard level with two players. It was very satisfying.
OK, this has his a 10 for me. Every game has been enjoyable and its playability for me is fantastic.
2.20.14 Taught this to more new people. I don't think this game will ever be pushed off the 10 spot for me. Your Mileage May Vary.

item.name: Pandemic: The Cure
item.comment: 1.3.14 After several 2 player games and a 4 player game, I do enjoy this lighter version on the main board game. Since some in our group do not like the base game, this is a good cross over for them.

item.name: Panic on Wall Street!
item.comment: 1.12.14 Two games. First was with six player and was fun. 2nd game was with 9 players. While a little chaotic with big numbers, it's loud, fun, and very enjoyable. It's great that both sides are playing against each other, so there are two winners. ON the managers side, it's tough to keep track of who is winning, but I enjoy the bidding for new business to sell. On the buyers part, there is the thrill of investing and the payoff or losing money. Lot's of meta gaming for both sides. Won't play this all the time, but I do like the game, thus my rating of 8.

item.name: Panzer General: Allied Assault
item.comment: Xbox Plays, not sure if I would pay for the full boardgame version.

item.name: Panzer Grenadier: Airborne (Introductory Edition)
item.comment: Great battle system. It has enought to make a good war game, but not too rules intensive to scare off a would be gamer. I think this is a great game to cut your teeth with for hex and counter games..

item.name: PanzerBlitz
item.comment: For an old hex and counter game this is one of the easier ones to learn. Suffers badly from you go, I got syndrome. You just dash your units from cover to cover and you enemy cannot do anything. Still fun game with light rules for the era.

item.name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Rise of the Runelords – Base Set
item.comment: 8.30.13 I just got this and it was highly anticipated. It gets an instant 10 from me. This may go down after some plays but for now it's a 10. 9/12.13 I have played now solo, two player, and 4 players. I think two player is the sweet spot as the game does not drag too much. I love that I can get a RPG itch (lightly) scratched in solo play. I'm not expecting this game to be an actual RPG or expect it to do more than it is.... and with that I am truly satisfied. This games is more of a card management game with an RPG lite theme, dice, and an objective. For me it does just what I want it to. Looking forward to future missions packs to see if they expand the look at locations to find bad guy mechanic.

item.name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Rise of the Runelords – Character Add-On Deck
item.comment: 1.12.14 While not a must for the game, its nice for bigger game groups. I think the base characters are better than these here.

item.name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Rise of the Runelords – The Skinsaw Murders Adventure Deck 2
Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Skull & Shackles – Base Set
item.comment:
10.3.14 got this on a great sale. owned the original game and loved it. On first pass I gave this a 6.4. While I liked the system, it seemed the new "theme" added some confusing overhead to the game.
10.4.14 After 4 more plays I am upping my score a full point to 7.4 (not quite an 8). All the fluff, while adding some complexity to the system, really help to make each scenario different from the others. They give a feel which can really change how you approach each game and the cards that fit best into your deck.

item.name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Wrath of the Righteous – Base Set
Phantom Leader
item.comment: Another Solo DVD game. I like the improvements that have been made from the Hornet Leader game. It adds a bit more depth without adding a whole lot of rules. I like the campaign lengths. This is a must for solo war games. Campaign play is even more compelling. I repeat this is a must for solo war gamers.

item.name: Phase 10 Dice
item.comment: We play the card version of phase 10. This dice game is easier and MUCH faster. Not a bad filler. Wife and I play while we watch TV, but it can be boring at times. Sometimes you just need the dice to roll a certain way and your just dependent on the dice.

item.name: Pirate's Cove
item.comment: Random, Check. Pirates, Check. Fun dice rolling, Check. Great bits, Check. If you like the above then get this game. Its not deep, but make for nice light or family game.

item.name: Pirates of the Spanish Main
item.comment: Great fun game. I like that you can play it anywhere. Collectable cards make for fun when buying.

item.name: Pizza Box Football
item.comment: Love to play this fun and fast game with my son. Easy to play, but fun.

item.name: Pokémon Master Trainer
item.comment: The game just drags on WAY to long. You need to be pumped up for the final battle and have an evolved pokemon to stand a chance. Just to long. There is a decent game here, it just needed to be tweaked!

item.name: Pokémon Trading Card Game
item.comment: Great little card game to play with my pre teen kids. On a basic level it makes them think about their actions and I like it for that. We just play the basic starter kit with a few cards thrown in for fun. Easy light weight fun that work when im in the mood.

item.name: Poker
item.comment: Poker, I hardly know her.

item.name: Quicksand
item.comment: Quick blind racing game. Works well as a family game for me. Can be played with my little ones and still gives enough decisions to keep it interesting for the adults playing.

item.name: Qwixx
item.comment:
11.4.14 My group loves dice games so this fit right in. We like that each turn you have choices to make weather you roll or not. I said it was like Yahtzee with colors and you can play every turn. While nothing special the game has found a place in our group and well give this more plays.
1.11.15 This game has been a huge success. We play this almost every game night now and have laminated out score sheets. I would recommend you give this game at least at a try.
4.12.15 After numerous plays I have increased my rating to 8 based on the amount of fun we get out of this game. Works good from 2-5.

item.name: Railways of the World
item.comment:
Great Game. There are so many ways to win and thwart would be winners that I seem to try something new each time. Player interaction is great and there is about as much direct conflict as you can get without a war game. I personally like the bidding for turn order as well as random cube draws. I give this a 10 for the simple fact that I always enjoy the game when I play it. It is easy to learn, has tons of options each turn, but yet it can be taught and picked up by new players in a few turns. Just what I want from a game.
After repeated plays with several game groups, this game never fails to be satisfying. A solid 10 game for me.
1/7/12 After another play, this game is still a 10 for me!

item.name: Red November
item.comment: Many plays, then I traded it away. I think the small board was a killer for me. The game was fun, almost like a game of Suduko.

item.name: The Resistance
item.comment:
Quite an interesting game. While some in our game group loved it right away, others did not get it.
The game has some great concepts and I think would go well with some larger groups... over 6? The only real issue I had with the game is that the spies won all 3 of our games. It's really hard to out the spies to get in 3 victories for the resistance. I'd love to see more balance. Still some fun and riotous behavior to be had.

item.name: Revolution!
item.comment: Love this game. It was a big hit with my group. An initial 8. will revise after more plays.

item.name: Risk: Star Wars – The Clone Wars Edition
Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island
item.comment: 3.11.14 Im starting the game off with a 9, but it is already close to a 10 for me. The only thing that makes it a 9 right now was the amount of effort it took to learn the game. The rule book is helpful once you learn the game, but it's hard to learn directly from it. With that the said, the game is wonderful. Hard choices, exciting events, great components, flows well (once you learn it) and lots of game play. I can't wait to play this and see if it gets to a 10 or 8 for me.

item.name: RoboRally
item.comment:
Fun game with lots of mayhem. Seems like it should be so easy to get from point A to point B. Roborally makes for an interesting light and fun game.
While I thoroughly enjoy this game, I find it tough to find other who do as much as I do. It can really get out of hand with too many players, but I like that part.
9/4/11 Played a few more games of this and I give this a solid 8. I enjoy this each time I play. If the theme sounds as good as sounds to you, you'll love it.

item.name: Roll Through the Ages: The Bronze Age
item.comment: Dropped my score from an initial 8 down to a 7. While I do still find this game fun to play, the scope is very limited. Kudos for solo play, but just not enough there to keep this fresh in our game group.

item.name: Runebound (Second Edition)
item.comment: I love the theme. This game has exactly what it should, but just drags on a bit. Small niggle things keep this from being rated higher, but will I do enjoy this and look forward to bringing out from time to time.

item.name: Saboteur
item.comment: 6.8.14 Sold to Jarred.

item.name: Say Anything
item.comment:
Another great fast lightweight party game from Northstar.
I was able to play this with a mix group of people in both age and background and it went over very well. Super simple to teach that even non gamers can get the hang of it rather quickly.
If your looking for a game that supports 8 people well and is fun to play, this is a good bet.
12.15.13 This game supports up to 8 which is hard to find. A good middle weight game that works well with a mixed group. What I said above still stands true.

item.name: Scene It? Seinfeld
item.comment: I like the scene it, but not a big Seinfeld fan. Rating would go up if I was a Seinfeld fan.

item.name: Scotland Yard
item.comment: I really like this one vs many types of games. While this one has some fun built in, it really is hard to escape as Mr. X in my games. Still, nice fun deduction and bluff game.

item.name: Scrabble Slam!
item.comment:
An ok game to play with time or space constraints.
Pros: Fast to play, easy to learn, if you can spell you can play. Can get multiple games in quickly. Can be fun with the right crowd and word mix.
Cons: If you can't spell you'll suck at it, mostly mindless dribble.
Raised my rating from a 5 to 6 after more plays. Sure it's not a brain burner, but it is fun for what it is. Get the right group and fun will be had.

item.name: Scream Machine
item.comment: Interesting trick taking type game. Played only 1 time so far and I liked it. Good for a family game. Looking forward to another game to see how well it plays.

item.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse
item.comment: 9.12.13 I have a few plays under my belt. I have upgraded my rating from 7 to 8. The game really does a good job at (comically) simulation a fight between heroes and a villain. While there can be a bit of book keeping in all the pluses, minuses, and adjustments, I find them right before the edge of too much. Our games have been close and we look forward to fighting a new villain with new heroes. I like that you can get low on cards, but usually you have a few options on what to do. With more heroes, the choices get more enhanced and fun.

item.name: Shadow Hunters
item.comment: 2/18/13 What a great game. I love the hidden roles and semi co-op of this. Easy to learn and play with nice deduction and take that. A winner for me.

item.name: Shadows over Camelot
item.comment: A great co-op game. One of the best in fact. Each character has a different power. I'm not totally sold on the traitor aspect (yes, it's a main draw of the game). We have found that if the traitor unmasks himself early on, he/she can do a lot of damage and win most games. Still, the game is a beauty in production and very solid. Still one of my favorites.

item.name: Small World
item.comment: Only one play, and I still need to play more of this.

item.name: Sorry! Madagascar Edition
item.comment: Not a bad family game. The cards speed up the original game by making it easier to get your pawns to home. Not the best, but some simple family fun.

item.name: Sorry! Sliders
item.comment:
Some nice light dexterity fun. I enjoy it... it gets an 8.
9/20/11 Lowered my rating down to 7. Sure it fun, but very basic.

item.name: Space Hulk (third edition)
item.comment: Im jumping on the band wagon here, but this is one fine game. The tension is just right for me. The game is easy to learn and play and the game looks fantastic setup. I only have a few plays under my belt, but I will revise as needed...maybe to 11.

item.name: Splendor
item.comment: 8.4.15. While I do the elegance in the design of this game, to me, the flaws outweigh the fun I have when I play this game. First the game is almost too simple for my tastes. While I don't mind simple games in general, if you couple this with an AP person, this games becomes almost unbearable. The other real issues I have is with serious vs casual players. I all my games, I got to the left of a person who watched the board and took what I needed when able. I did my best to go with what I had. The person across had a person who just kinda took what looked good. Each game that person across just killed us all. I like a game where my decisions matter to help me build up my game and are not heavily dependent on what the person before me does.

item.name: Star Trek: Expeditions
item.comment: Fist off, I want to say I love both Co-op and Start Trek Themed games. So the draw for me in this game is large to begin with. After two plays, I enjoy the mechanic very much. I will have to try it on harder settings as both games were on cadet settings and while fun and a bit challenging where never really that close. I will revise after more plays.

item.name: Star Wars Miniatures
item.comment: I really like the game. The rules are simple (maybe to simple) but they cover all the basics and have attack and force rules. The basic set is a good deal in my eyes. The best pre painted minis I have seen so far

item.name: Star Wars: Imperial Assault
item.comment: 8.20.15 Have played the intro game a few time and now working through the campaing. Right now I am loving this game and giving a through 9.5 and we have not even started to skirmish yet. I like both the theme (star wars) and the rather short missions that can be done usually under two hours with setup and take down. 10.19.15 After getting into the campaign game and moving it along, I am going to bump this to a 10. It just hits the sweet spots for me in the these campaign type games.

item.name: Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game
item.comment:
9/23/12 What a great game. I was put off a little by the hype of this game, but after three plays, I must say im impressed.
I'm impressed on how easy the game is to teach a play. It has enough depth to be exciting without the rules getting in the way. The models are great and all components are of top notch.
Can't wait for more plays and my initial rating is a 9.

item.name: Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – Millennium Falcon Expansion Pack
Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – TIE Fighter Expansion Pack
Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – TIE Interceptor Expansion Pack
Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – X-Wing Expansion Pack
Start Player: A Kinda Collectible Card Game
Stellar Conquest
item.comment: Interesting light space exploration game. Its surprisingly easy on the rules for an exploration game. Can be fun but a little long on written note taking during the game.

item.name: Suburbia
item.comment: 11.4.14 Only plays have been solo, so I can only comment on that part. I do like that it plays solo... good to have a game that gives that option. Looking forward to a 2-3 player game soon.

item.name: Summoner Wars
item.comment:
Been eying this game for a while. After playing it I must say I am impressed at the simplicity. While there is always just a bit more that you need to do, you can do just enough to get your plans executed.
While, the game could be a bit more complicated (IMO) it does well for what it is. A nice quick hand management battle to the death.

item.name: Summoner Wars: Guild Dwarves vs Cave Goblins
item.comment: Expansion for the game. Only one play, but I like what I see.

item.name: Summoner Wars: Phoenix Elves vs Tundra Orcs
Survive: Escape from Atlantis! 5-6 Player Mini Expansion
Telestrations
item.comment: What a great party game this is. Light, fun and always laughter when we play. I have revised my rating from a 7 to 8 after repeated plays. The fact that this plays up to 8 people is great. Also, super easy to learn and teach.

item.name: Terror in Meeple City
item.comment: 4.14.14 I must admit and I love this game more than I thought I would. It' simple dexterity fun. There is a game underneath all that fun dexterity stuff and the game has shown to surprise us with unique outcomes after a half dozen plays. I have enjoyed each play and my rating of a 9 seems pretty solid. I'll see how time treats it.

item.name: Through the Ages: A Story of Civilization
item.comment: The ultimate in a civilization building game for me. While I only have 2 plays of this at a con, I was hooked. There were so many things going on at one that it was truly a wonder the game worked so well. Many, many avenues to win and build your civilization. While veterans will have an advantage over new players, this game can be played over and over.

item.name: Thunderstone
item.comment:
A great deck building game. I prefer this so much more than Dominion. I have played solo, two and three player. Each time I add a person my rating goes up. A three player game was as good as it gets for me.
The fact that you can go to town to buy or to the Dungeon Hall to kill a monster make the game more flavored and diverse. You cant just get a lot of card combos like in Dominion. You need to do what is best with your hand. Killing monsters is the way to get Victory Points, but you can't do this until you get the right mix in your deck, which you get from going to the town.
Note: Rating has gone up after a few more plays.

item.name: Ticket to Ride
item.comment: Im in the majority that love this game. A bit simple, but easy to teach and fun to play. Not too deep so you get mired down with the thought process. Works well with everybody I have introduced it too. I am always up for a game of this! Lowered my score to 8 on 6/29/09. I still love this game, but it is just to simple to give it a higher rating. As an intro to the hobby game, it still rates a 9 though.

item.name: Ticket to Ride: 10th Anniversary
item.comment: 8.2.14 While I give regular TTR a 7 (i think), I have bumped this one up to a nine for the incredible job they have done on the components. It is in every way a beautiful looking game and well done. I love the big map, large cards, and the addition of routes from the expansions. If you just so so to TTR this will be the same. For me, it was a great addition to the series.

item.name: Ticket to Ride: Märklin
item.comment: The passenger aspect of the game make for a nice twist. The map leaves a little more wiggle room so it's hard to block off. Basically Ticket to Ride with a bit more flavor.
item.conditiontext: Box is damaged pretty good, but the contents are in great condition.

item.name: Ticket to Ride: Mystery Train Expansion
item.comment: A little more fun for a great game.

item.name: Tide of Iron
item.comment: The gameplay is fantastic on the game. I really like the idea of firing for casualties or to surpress. The game flows smoothly and the rules come to hand after a few times though. The components are fantastic. This is the step up from Memoir that I was really looking for. A bit pricey, but still a good buy with all the stuff you get in the box.

item.name: Tobruk: Tank Battles in North Africa 1942
Toc Toc Woodman: Golden Axe Expansion
Toc Toc Woodman: Golden Core and Bark Promo
Treasures & Traps
item.comment: Interesting little game. It seemed that a victor was elusive for any of us. The cards always seemed to be not quite enough to win, but not quite enough to stop another player. It dragged on longer that it should have for me. Still, nice idea that I am willing to give another try.

item.name: Tumblin-Dice Jr.
item.comment: While this is a true dexterity game, I do find this fun. It very easy to play while watching some football and drinking beer. While I rate this game low, I have a lot of plays. Fun when in the mood. 5.27.14 This game has found a place in my group game rotation. I have moved its score from 6 to 7. Not cause it's so good, but because we have fun when we play it.

item.name: Twilight Struggle
item.comment: My first card driven "war game". I love the idea and implementation of this game. Lots to do with hard decisions. The influence mechanic is a must try at least once. The game can be very interesting with the right opponent.
item.conditiontext: got in ding and dent. game is in like new condition, box has a dent in upper right corner.

item.name: Twilight Struggle
item.comment: The mounted board and fixes makes this a nine for me. See comments for 1st edition.

item.name: Twister
item.comment:
It's twister.
Play while a teenager with other teenagers.

item.name: Tzolk'in: The Mayan Calendar
item.comment: Very dense work placement game. Lots going on in this one with several strategies and engines to explore. I enjoyed this, but there was almost too much going on. A very well put together game just a bit too long for me with a few too many choices.

item.name: U-Boat Leader
item.comment:
A different type of Solo game from DVD games. In most others, you know what you need to do and try to build up for it.
In U-boat you get loaded up with weapons and go out and look for trouble without getting into too much. It's a risk-reward decisions that drive this game.

item.name: UNO
item.comment: Uno may sometimes get a bad rap, but I like the game. It's fast, fun, and easy to learn. Plus, almost everybody has played it so there is not much to teach. Its one of the games I can play with my 6 year old daughter, my wife, and grandmother.

item.name: UNO Attack!
item.comment: A variation of the classic card game of Uno. While the unpredictable nature of the card shoot is interesting, it does not seem to keep the same that that nature of the classic card game. I have only played a few times and need more plays to give a final rating. As of now, I could take it or leave it.

item.name: Vegas Showdown
item.comment: Enjoyable light bidding and tile laying game. Many ways to try and gain the lead with money to outbid, fame to win, and building your casino to make the others try and keep up. Very enjoyable game for both gamers and non-gamers with the social aspect being the best. After about 5 games this has become my favorite bidding/ middle weight game. Plays good with three to five.

item.name: A Victory Lost
item.comment: 2/18/13 Learned this at Stragicicon. Loved this game. I especially liked the chit pulling system along with the ebb and flow of the full game. Fairly easy to play for a war game and each side plays much different.

item.name: War of the Ring (first edition)
item.comment: A fantastic epic game. Has combat, card play, and movement and searching for the ring barer. While I need more plays this game was impressive to me and I would love to play over and over.

item.name: Washington's War
item.comment: Great two player card driven game. I love how all the different actions mix together. My only real complaint about the game is combat. It is very convolution, especially for the first game, but it seems very hard to mount any real combat campaign.

item.name: Wings of War: Famous Aces
item.comment: Traded away. There was just something missing in this game for me.

item.name: Winner's Circle
item.comment: I was surprised how much I liked this game. It was easy to learn, fun, and did not have too much down time. I think this will play well with 2 and up to 4. Looking forward to playing this as its a filler with a little more meat. Good to introduce non-gamers into the hobby.
item.conditiontext: Very good condition. Slight ding on box (very minor)- components are in great shape.

item.name: Wits & Wagers
item.comment: I liked this game. The questions were a little crazy so very few of them could be guessed exactly. Makes for a fun trivia and betting game. Goes over well with non gamers or a mixed crowd. Has the elements of both trivia and betting.

item.name: Wits & Wagers Family
item.comment:
A great addition to the Wits & Wagers games. Balanced well for family situations. The questions are a bit lighter and there is no direct betting, but more scoring points.
While I do like it, it does take a bit of the betting aspect of the game. A great game for family nights or get togethers.
This game went over very well with non games.
I have raised my rating to an 8 after more plays. This is due to the fact that I have used to this to have non-gamers as well as people who don't like games to play.

item.name: Yahtzee
item.comment: I like playing dice game. This game is easy to setup, play, and find players for. It travels well and is great for playing with your favorite adult beverage.

item.name: Zombie Dice
item.comment: 6.24.14 This game is very basic. Roll the dice and get brains without getting shotgunned. While it's super light it does a great spot in my game collection. Perfect for those times you just want to sit around and play something fast. Super portable and easy to teach. My score of 6 is for the game mechanics and play which is pretty much straight forward and easy.

item.name: Zooloretto
item.comment:
Traded away. Just a little to light for my tastes. A nice little family game, but it just not grab ours. Moving animals around was just not enough.
Re aquired from my Secret Santa. This game has gone over much better the second round in a different game group. Thus I am raising my rating on the game to a 7.5
10.7.13 This game with the right group is fun. While it still is a bit light for me, I find that it works perfect for game groups that are not into heaver longer games.
